title: Police seek mother over babies dead in freezer
content: A 39-year-old French woman is wanted for alleged infanticide after DNA testing confirmed she was the mother of two babies found dead in a freezer at her Seoul home. The woman and her French husband, who said he found the infants after returning from holiday, have denied they are the parents of the babies. Their lawyer said the South Korean police could not prove that hair and other material from the home, used to match DNA with the babies, belonged to the woman. The couple are now in France, and police want the woman extradited to South Korea.
summary:
A 39-year-old French woman is wanted for alleged infanticide after DNA testing confirmed she was the mother of two babies found dead in a freezer at her Seoul home.
The woman and her French husband, who said he found the infants after returning from holiday, have denied they are the parents of the babies.
Their lawyer said the South Korean police could not prove that hair and other material from the home, used to match DNA with the babies, belonged to the woman.
The couple are now in France, and police want the woman extradited to South Korea.
